title: Lake Clark National Park & Preserve: Multimedia Presentations
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations               Multimedia Presentations                                Over the Mountains Lake Clark’s rich coastal habitats provide great opportunities to see and study brown bears.   The park’s much larger inland habitat is home to a population of bears that we know little about.  Through a multi year study scientist are learning how brown bears survive in the park’s more resource constrained interior.An Audio Described version of this film is available at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cypb0TI3C4I  Duration:7 minutes, 58 seconds                                The Count Sockeye salmon are a critical part of the Lake Clark story.  Through ongoing monitoring and a variety of research projects, park scientists have been able to track the population and gain key insights into the lives of Lake Clark's sockeye salmon. An Audio Described version of this film is available at: https://youtu.be/GtSsCdbVn-U  Duration:8 minutes, 20 seconds                  Interactive Panoramas Take a virtual tour of the park through these spectacular, high resolution interactive panoramic photographs.                        A Photographic Journey Through Lake Clark National Park Join us for this 4-minute trip through spectacular Lake Clark National Park and Preserve. Sound is music only.  Duration:4 minutes, 25 seconds                                Aerial Tour of Redoubt Volcano Join us for a spectacular aerial tour of Redoubt Volcano!Audio is music only.  Duration:2 minutes, 36 seconds                                Aerial Tour of Iliamna Volcano Join us for a short aerial tour of this spectacular volcano! Audio is music only.  Duration:1 minute, 47 seconds                                No Place Like Twin Lakes Learn about Dick Proenneke's cabin on Twin Lakes  Duration:14 minutes, 50 seconds
